cot.content:

Answer: The Phaeacians live on the island of Scheria.

In the historical period, the Achaeans were the inhabitants of the region of Achaea, a region in', 'Document 5 (Title: Pytheas): Arctic pole", as some translations say. The numerous population of natives, he says, live in thatched cottages, store their grain in subterranean caches and bake bread from it. They are "of simple manners" ("ēthesin haplous") and are content with plain fare. They are ruled by many kings and princes who live in peace with each other. Their troops fight from chariots, as did the Greeks in the Trojan War. The Phaeacians play a crucial role in the narrative of the Odyssey, as they provide Odysseus with a means to return home after his long and arduous journey. The numerous population of natives, he says, live in thatched cottages, store their grain in subterranean caches and bake bread from it. They are "of simple manners" ("ēthesin haplous") and are content with plain fare. They are ruled by many kings and princes who live in peace with each other. Their troops fight from chariots, as did the Greeks in the Trojan War.
